alert.note: Alert for Marinette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 03 at 10:14AM CDT until May 08 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Wisconsin, including the following county, Marinette. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1011 AM CDT, dam operators reported fast river flows downstream of the Kingsford and Big Quinnesec Falls Dam. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding include... Niagara. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
